div.p: CHRONEVENT is an element contained by a DIV1, that holds together a single CHRONSTRUCT element and perhaps an optional SHORTPROSE: all relevant information pertaining to a free-standing chronology event as well as its explanatory material. Each CHRONEVENT should have at least one BIBCIT associated with it. In author entries (both BIOGRAPHY and WRITING sections), CHRONEVENTS are not needed: CHRONSTRUCTS (sometimes followed in the same DIV2 by a contextual or explanatory SHORTPROSE) do without this element. CHRONEVENTs have in the past been collected in an events document ready for processing into the system.

div.p: Individual CHRONEVENTS will appear in search results on the over-arching project chronology or within subject-specific timelines and time-specific timelines. Because of the multiple contexts in which a CHRONEVENT can appear, it is vital that each event be conceptually independent. Please make sure that all pronouns used in a CHRONEVENT have their referent in the chronProse of that event. Also make sure that all NAMES, DATES, PLACES, and ORGNAMES are tagged once per CHRONEVENT.
